Argentina: Pacto Federal signed between provinces to protect federal nature of country The Voyage of the Beagle with Charles Darwin and Robert FitzRoy visited the Río de la Plata, Patagonia and Tierra del Fuego (to 1834) Argentine Governor of the Falkland Islands Luis Vernet is expelled by USS Lexington following his seizure of United States interests. New governor murdered in 1832 mutiny
Australia: Administration of King George Sound passes to Swan River Colony, convicts returned to New South Wales. The Sydney Herald (later to become The Sydney Morning Herald) was first published.
Barbados: Free coloured men who meet the property requirements, are given the right to vote for members of Parliament.
Belgium:
Leopold, Prince of Coburg, sworn in as king of the Belgians.
Ten Days' Campaign: Dutch attempt to re-establish rule over Belgium fails, but Dutch forces retain control of Antwerp Citadel.
Brazil:
Dom Pedro I abdicates as Emperor of Brazil in favor of his 5-year-old son Dom Pedro II, who will reign for almost 59 years.
Slave trading is forbidden in Brazil, the law is largely ignored.
Chile: José Joaquín Prieto becomes president of Chile. He will serve two consecutive five-year terms. With him, the so-called decenios (decade-long reigns) begin, which continue until 1871. This 30-year Conservative Party hegemony is sometimes referred to as the Authoritarian Republic.
Colombia: Joaquín Mariano Mosquera y Arboleda is President of the Republic of New Granada
France: First Canut revolt: first clearly defined worker uprising of the Industrial Revolution.
Haiti: The city of Pétion-Ville, a suburb of Port-au-Prince named for Alexandre Pétion, is founded by Boyer
Ireland: Tithe War: A force of one hundred and twenty armed police forcibly takes possession of cattle belonging to a Roman Catholic priest, in lieu of his compulsory tithe to the Anglican Church of Ireland.
Italy:
Austrian troops gradually crush political resistance along the Italian peninsula.
The political movement Young Italy is formed by activist Giuseppe Mazzini, promoting insurrection in Italian states and Austrian lands to help unify Italy.
Lebanon: Bashir II breaks away from the Ottoman Empire, allies with Muhammad Ali of Egypt and assists Muhammad Ali's son, Ibrahim Pasha, in another siege of Acre. This siege lasted seven months, the city falling on 27 May 1832. The Egyptian army, with assistance from Bashir's troops, also attacked and conquered Damascus on 14 June 1832.
Malta: The diocese of Malta is separated from that of Palermo.
Russia: November Uprising: An act of the Sejm dethroned Nicholas from the Polish crown. November Uprising: A new government took office in Poland. November Uprising: Russian troops crossed the Polish border. Battle of Warsaw (1831): The Russian army captured Warsaw, ending the November Uprising.
Tonga: Tāufaʻāhau I proclaimed himself King George Tupou I.
